tours.title: Welcome to Maseru
tours.description: You're in Maseru, the capital of the Kingdom in the Sky. Founded in 1869 as a trading post, today it's a vibrant hub of Basotho culture and modern Lesotho life.
facts: Historical: Named after the red sandstone 'red rock' nearby.
Modern: Home to the National University of Lesotho and weekly craft markets.

tours.title: Thaba-Bosiu National Monument
tours.description: The Mountain of Night â€“ birthplace of the Basotho nation. King Moshoeshoe I's 1824 fortress was never conquered.
facts: Historical: Symbol of unity during the Lifaqane wars.
Modern: UNESCO tentative site with cultural village and hiking.

tours.title: Maletsunyane Falls
tours.description: Africa's highest single-drop waterfall at 192m. Sacred to the Basotho, now a world-class abseiling site.
facts: Modern: Semonkong Lodge offers pony treks and the longest commercial abseil.

tours.title: Katse Dam
tours.description: Africa's second-largest arch dam (1996). Part of the Lesotho Highlands Water Project.
facts: Historical: Engineering marvel from post-independence era.
Modern: Supplies water to Gauteng and generates hydro-power.

tours.title: Sehlabathebe National Park
tours.description: UNESCO World Heritage site with 2,000-year-old San rock art and dramatic Drakensberg scenery.
facts: Modern: Pristine hiking, birdwatching, and stargazing.
